intro: Echinospermum patulum, commonly known as the spiny sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the family. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and have a serrated edge, while the stem is spiny and erect. Echinospermum patulum is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
